question:
Which of the following were the followers of the new religion introduced by Akbar called Din-i-Ilahi?
1) Birbal
2) Abul Fazal
3) Abul Faizi
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: Akbar promulgated a new religion called Din-i-Ilahi or Tauhind-i-Ilahi (Divine Monotheism) in c1582 CE. He believed in one God and in Sul-i-Kul/peace to all. During his lifetime, it had only followers including Birbal, Abul Fazl, and Abul Faizi.
